pqlPERWyU4zMytnonSwR6g.text: Nice atmosphere, good food - Sesame Inn gets an A in my book.  The service is good - I especially like the man who has been refilling water glasses since I was in middle school and always smiles at you.  There is a room off the main dining room to support larger groups, a full bar, and a great menu.  The lunch specials are very affordable, even to high school students, and can be packed on days when school lets out early.  As far as the food goes, everything is delicious.  The hot and sour soup is great, the ma po bean curd is the best I've ever had, and even their newest offering of pad thai is pretty good.  Whether you're taking out, eating in, or having food delivered, everything here is delicious.

SzVT52sDgIc1qbOp6jOUYQ.text: I walked in to place a to-go order.  The joint was very busy, but worth the wait -about 30 minutes. Very comfy waiting area just off the main dining room.  The Hunan Chicken was spicy without being too salty & the eggrolls were crisp but not greasy.  Only negative I'd give is to the hostess, who was a bit snarky when I ordered, but I'll give her some leeway based on the crowd that was there.  I'd go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Sesame Inn Chinese Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

LBwrv4HgcDr-cIxIXKkBPg.text: My grandmother lives in Washington, PA. Several times a year, I go to visit her and we make the trek to Sesame Inn. I absolutely love their lettuce wraps, Pad Thai, and/or Singapore Noodles. We normally share the wraps and an order of the Pad Thai. It is a huge portion. Even while sharing, we still take left overs home! Great!!!!

yKKLy-_i0GHdqTbD6FaeZw.text: I have eaten at 3 Sesame Inn locations now (several times). Mt Lebanon, the Canonsburg location and the Station Square location. The menus are all the same but there are subtle differences between each. For example, the kung pao chicken is breaded lightly at the Station Square location but is not at the Canonsburg location. Service is generally good and they are responsive to customized dishes or requests. Pretty good as far as Pittsburgh dining goes.

8p5Ko_sN4lQBuyYVw87-7w.text: I love this place!  I've been eating here since I was a little kid and it's always been a favorite!   The lunch menu is a great deal because it includes a soup or egg roll, so we usually try to go for lunch. The staff is always really friendly and quick.  My dad is a dentist in uptown Mt. Lebanon and even though this is a sit-down restaurant, you can always run in for a quick lunch and make it back to the office on time.   Take-out is very convenient too.  We often get take-out and it's usually ready to pick up around 15 minutes after you order it! I think the prices are pretty reasonable.  You can usually get lunch for under $10.  Dinner is a little pricier, but the dinners are definitely big enough for 2 people to share. On top of all that, the food is really good!  I've lived in LA for a year now and obviously there are a ton of places to get Chinese food out here, but I still think that Sesame Inn is my favorite!  I definitely highly recommend this place!  I know I'm always dying to eat here every time I'm in Pittsburgh!

7ecwTgRfQnix3Uy5vz5BoA.text: My wife and I and our son love this restaurant. Once you have Chinese food here you will select this as your top Chinese restaurant. Everyone is so friendly, the service is excellent and the food always comes nice and hot. They also have some excellent Thai specialties. I recommend the KieWan if you like Thai dishes. The amazing chicken will keep you coming back time and time again.  I cannot recommend this place enough; try it and I bet you agree.

2jLz9N2azz4PFjDx3F-UDg.text: Friends and I were looking to order Chinese food on a Sunday afternoon. Unfortunately, Sesame Inn doesn't deliver until after 4pm. They're prices are a little more expensive than other Chinese places I've been too and the quantity of food is less as well. Quality of the food we ordered was find though and ready for pick-up when we arrived. Unless I was really craving Chinese food, I'd probably go with somewhere else.

N85f83f8TQM0fY8I5eKtYw.text: If you are looking for authentic Chinese food, this isn't the place.  If you are looking for well made food with generous portions, you have come to the right place!

1UZEaBgFTKWfxr23ohabPw.text: Tasty Chinese food and equally tasty sushi. Friendly staff.

MhEHI9W2lLGptGHepvvwtg.text: Sesame Inn was the place we went when we wanted Chinese food when I was growing up in Pittsburgh. My family owned a Chinese restaurant themselves and when they wanted Chinese food this is where we went. I remember the walnut chicken and the orange beef the most. What I would give to have some. The dumplings were also a favorite of mine too!! Just another place I will be sure to visit when I travel back to the Burgh.

iLgsV9LmMiSa3g27cP_37A.text: The Sesame Inn is a nice Chinese restaurant in Mt. Lebanon.  Inside is well decorated with mirrors lining most of the walls.  We went for lunch and found it to be unexpectedly busy (and parking was tight), but we were seated quickly.  Service was excellent.  Our server was very friendly and helpful and made sure our water glasses were always full and everything was to our liking.  The food was standard Chinese fare.  They also appeared to have a few Thai selections, although we did not try them.  Our entrees were nothing out of the ordinary, but the pu pu appetizer platter was quite delicious.  Meals are large and come with rice and soup for lunch.  Prices were reasonable for lunch, but are several dollars more for dinner.

s39915F9We5FAy1mtcrsKA.text: If you're seeking bland, salty, Chinese food where every entree tastes exactly the same as the other...this is your place!

BeJc9NYOn45SWk7b9gkeww.text: A small group and couldn't decide what type of food to get...so we went to Sesame.  Fun place for a small group, you can share and try different items on the menu.    The Thai items on the menu caught my eye or was it my taste buds.  Enjoyed the Pad Thai Shrimp, while the menu states it is spicy, not to much, was expecting more spice.  Sampled another Pad Thai, forgot the name, and it was not as spicy as I was expecting but good.  The Amazing Chicken turn out to be not so amazing.  It was OK but expected more.       SI is popular and I can see why.  Nice place and good service.

cGuq9eJXdBGY6DrWddnDog.text: The oil to sauce ratio for my Kung pao chicken was 1:1 - maybe worse.  I couldn't eat it.  I literally had to rinse it off under hot water in order to salvage a few bites.  This isn't the first time that I have had this problem here.  Takeout is gross.  I won't be back.

Wz4JrdLcXwzWAdJOVpVNig.text: This is my first yelp review. I set up a account just for this review.  I was deeply sadden by the food I received today.   I first started coming here since 1993. I have moved to Midwest four years later. However,  every times I drive thru Pittsburgh,I always stopped here. I really enjoy the general Tso' s chicken. As part of preparation, chicken was fried ahead of time,and fried again when you order, That is why their general Tso's Chicken was so crispy and aromatic when served. I did not have to make this stop, but after driving 450 miles, I wanted a decent meal.  Well, I stopped by and order the Dish for carry out. When I open them(it was not long, 30 minutes or less), they were so soggy, and based on my experience who grew up on Chinese food, it was not fried the second time. The difference? They tasted worse than Buffet dish sitting above the steamer for hours.   Furthermore, I have ordered the shrimp with garlic sauce. Shrimp was hard to chew. It seems like the shrimp the simmered in the sauce for ages. There was no aroma from garlic or onion.   Being a decent cook myself, I can tell you those dishes I ordered were not cooked by the main chef, or secondary chef. I suspect this is  probably made by the guy who station the fryer. Truly, the taste of those two dishes were so awful, I toss them out. I purchase those passing Pittsburgh, not really possible asking for refund.  I have had so much memory with this place. Rest assured, I won't be coming ever. It was so bad, I would not dear to try again.   I do hope the owner sees this, and make a statement of this incident. I eager to see you standby your dishes again. If I see owner's rebuttal, I would love to call the owner to discuss this encounter further, and willing to be convinced to come back.  Sincerely

ZWMrBc4JZZdkyEEukRKFnQ.text: Like a lot of Asian places in Pittsburgh, they offer a mix of Thai, Japanese, and Chinese dishes. I liked their Kamikazi rolls. I LOVED their House Duck Special. Soooo succulent. The service was really good. The decor is stately.

tUwiFEg_IJiUzd1oCzhWDw.text: A wonderful place every time, I order things that are different, are they are find with it I like the volcano chicken with general So's sauce and they never make a fuss about it. And it still comes out perfect, no hassle ,

_AmbSOuXS3p0i7p3jgLeCQ.text: I am from Pittsburgh but live in San Francisco now, and I come home to eat at this place Every Single Time.   Best Chinese food of my life... veggie dumplings and some amazing chicken ALWAYS hit the spot.

drgUSqg6PjcV4TXvAIVAgA.text: We did like the food but sadly found out on the way out that they cook with MSG. Why would anyone want to eat anything with MSG? They did say the will not use it if you ask.

MRio2_k00-Q2K633hTeGxQ.text: It's been a little while since I was at this specific location, but the chain--as a whole--is decent.  PROS: Large portions Flavorful dishes Very nice staff Obviously a clean restaurant  CONS: Significantly overpriced for run of the mill Chinese food. (It's just that) Very run of the mill, nothing is very original or unique from the norm @ Chinese restaurants.  Nothing much else of interest to really point out. Very basic after that.  The restaurant is very normal for Chinese style restaurants.   No frills.

BgWQcQVxt0sS6zfln-MhNw.text: We used to be big fans of Sesame Inn, eating in or ordering takeout a few times per month. But their quality keeps going downhill, and we find ourselves eating it less and less frequently. It's been awhile since we've had an amazing meal. Tonight, the straw that broke the camel's back was that two of my takeout items were inedible. The wonton soup was so salty that it immediately shrivelled my lips.. And when we removed our egg rolls and set them on plates, they left little puddles of oil. I hope they get their act together and rise back to their former glory. We miss the excellent food that we used to get.

2V5sggq80OFFfQB_OOg7Wg.text: Honey Moon Duck? Yes, please. Now, I haven't had it in over 6 years, but I do remember getting it at some point in my life [OK, several -- no, make that many] points in my life, and it was good.  It's Chinese Food. They have a decent dining room, they do decent entrees, and they do take-out. Are you looking for something more?  No; you really just want the Honey Moon Duck [for two; and yes, you'll be eating the whole thing yourself].

8ai6FY3HbsdfyXPvdWGfRw.text: We typically come over here for lunches which are always very good and relatively cheap. Personally I don't usually think of a dinner out at a Chinese Restaurant is going to be excellent but this place was Dyn-O-mite!   We had reservations for 6 people on a Saturday night around 7:00 but got caught up in really bad traffic and couldn't make it until closer to 7:45. we called to adjust our reservation time and they had no issue to accommodate us.   It is simple enough just to park across the street in the public lot than drive around for street parking I think that the lot may even be free on Saturday nights. The plate serving sizes are pretty large so it makes it easy for everyone to try a little of everything which is the way we ran the dinner with our group. We order way too much food to say the least. Everything was flavorful and served up[ hot and steamy. We had so many dishes that I can't talk about how awesome each one was but the one that really stood out to me was the mussaman curry and fried tofu.  Usually with a group of 6 or more a smaller place like this might be overwhelmed with getting the plates out in a timely manner and relatively close together but this place did an excellent job. I will definitely put this place in my places to go for dinner file after this experience.

uTzWQ5SPiv0luigU5BQdLA.text: Absolutely amazing I usually don't venture out and we went to a new restaurant and I got a new dish, Capitol chicken it was truly amazing, wait staff is always there when you need them. would definitely go back!

sg-w9CmtP5Are1HCvGWtSQ.text: Phenomenal! The new sushi bar compares favorably to what I eat in Los Angeles.  I will absolutely go back.  The Chinese food is also authentic - sure there are basic things that satisfy most appetites but the variety is truly special.  Service is terrific - will absolutely go back next time in town!

BDHhO3aVd6JrfjmU7RXpQQ.text: Some of the highest quality and best Chinese food you'll find in the area, but with a price tag. This is a place to head to celebrate, not to consistently order out.

1ggAf83esWJp_jQfAg_pCg.text: My favorite Chinese food!  Shrimp with Cashew and Bride and Groom are my two mainstays right now.

cRMBLPjznwMGgaK9ONstnw.text: Stopped here for the first time for dinner. The portions were huge! And its not expensive at all. I had broccoli and chicken in white sauce with steamed rice, and hot tea.  It was good. The staff was friendly. I'd defiantly go back if I'm ever in the area again and wanting Chinese cuisine.

gmfFSvGe2W5JSWg9JN0DoQ.text: This is the only Chinese restaurant I will go to.  The quality of their meat is much higher than anything I've found at the chain/buffet-type places.  I love the Ginger Chicken, Double Delight (chicken and shrimp in brown sauce), and the Happy Family (chicken, shrimp, scallops, pork, and beef in brown sauce).  I've had the Salt and Pepper Shrimp which were good, but I prefer Chinese food that has some sauce on it.  I love the baby corn that comes with the meal and the zucchini.  The prices are higher than your standard Chinese place, but I feel that you get what you pay for.

vVitFimKOzdAiMg5zfDSdA.text: I have been a customer of sesame inn for many, many years. Growing up in Mount Lebanon, my parents always ordered from here and since I have moved back 11 years ago ,I have ordered at least once a week for my family. A couple weeks ago I had a house full of people and ordered over $100 worth of food for delivery. I am sorry to report that there were tiny brown bugs ALIVE AND MOVING in our chicken fried rice. Myself and six other adults were not hallucinating, they were actually in our food. The kids had eaten before us and we did not notice until we sat down to eat. I called and the way the situation was handled was absolutely unbelievable.they told me I should have put the bugs in a bag. We left the bugs in the rice when we returned the food. They claimed they didn't see any. Seeing as though I am a regular customer who has never complained, I could not believe they would not refund my money for the food that we were unable to consume. I will NEVER ORDER feom sesame Inn Again. Totally disgusting..I worked in the restaurant business for many years and none of my managers would have handled this situation as poorly as they have. Despicable and disgusting.

mKRALJKJyARM6k2ESe_aYw.text: Nice interiors ...food's just like any other chinese restaurant offering

5OLOfO6QXneViOyPXjN2hA.text: They have the best Chinese food in the South Hills!!!  I always get the amazing chicken and it is amazing. We have been going here for about 10 years or more and have never had a problem.  Have good lunch prices too  The only drawback is the parking is a little crazy

r2tFQcuMqKMCaQaAnxPE2Q.text: So apparently they have this business listed twice under different names but the same address and the closing time is wrong on both sites. I just called to inquire about their closing Time. The lady said they close at 945?? Two stars because they seem to not be able to get it together.

fo_J1FZ20o-MRFhh8iIdkw.text: We were freezing cold after sitting through a football game and I wanted Chinese food to warm me up. We almost turned away because of the look of the outside - don't let it fool you.  Go in, and upstairs and it will be well worth the choice.  This was one of the best Chinese meals I've had in many, many years. The hot/sour soup was very good, the egg roll, also good.  We tried the 3 Rivers Roll - OMG....I'll be craving that for a very, very long time.  We also go General Tsao's chicken - chunks of white meat and nicely crispy, lo-main, shrimp and garlic and a seafood dish (yep, only 3 of us, so WAY too much).  Everything was fantastic.  We'd go back in a heartbeat!!!

kbqx1LkYKPGQGmo3iJXkpw.text: I ate one bite of my Chinese and threw the rest away.  It was $40 for two take out meals and the beef sort of disintegrated in my mouth.  Not a good quality I would like to experience with meat.

oynJJaWLlZKLsHd7CIh86g.text: My first five start review! Service is perfection, listening to little requests and confirming them with a smile. The hot sour soup was meh but everything else was amazing! Consistently addictive!

b7U67ITitYbM5G9uH0KGVA.text: If Zero was an option I would use that for the number of stars to give Sesame Inn. Hair and my broccoli on multiple occasions for a takeout orders. Last evening hair on my avocado on my Pittsburgh roll. Last straw. Call this lovely establishment to get a refund (note: never called before to complain about the broccoli incidents) of which he refused to do and said I should bring back my trash and then I could get a full refund for my meal. When I asked to speak to the owner he refused that as well. I will never order from this disgusting place ever again, and I hope the health board checks out their kitchen. Disgusting food, terrible customer service. Be warned.

x9vKSRUKORKotaM3lQow1Q.text: The food here is better than a lot of your average Chinese delivery. The options are pretty standard, but their sushi is decent and well priced. Not gourmet, but tasty and regularly satisfies my fried Chinese food cravings.

pCElv_BLOXn1H_FvBvVkjw.text: If someone asks me what my fav place to eat is, I always say here! Delicious, hearty portions & great service. 5+ stars

3H6OM51FlyUmtivrYnfvxg.text: We've lived near this place for a few years only tried it recently. They have some awesome veggie selections and the food is delicious! The sushi was sooo good and the general tso's tofu was the best I've ever had. Really good service, large portions and we'll be back.

HeZN8lUukMVBMuCfZyyKwg.text: YUMMY! Not your typical chinese food what-so-ever. If you get the right waitress who can understand you she can help you work around the gluten free options and tells you what to avoid.   They also have a thai menu, their pad thai and curry is very good. It has good flavor and is a large portion. I always have enough for the next day or two.   Their lunch menu is the perfect size, it incudes a smaller portion, hot tea and soup/eggroll whichever you prefer, obviously I give both of those to whoever I am eating with.   Great for Take-out!

SKtA6OAiDxfW7DTgEdMi3w.text: Why didn't this list not wheelchair accessible? There's a flight of steps to go up and no other entrance. The one at Station Square accessible w Elevator. Put notices on these reviews of places accessible for wheelchairs and that includes bathrooms too  ! Make a ramp for disabled people in chairs or elderly who cant walk 2 flights up ACLU and Disabled rights would make be handicap accessible! Just so you know I been told that the station Square is closed? If anyone knows if its True please write. Today Jan 26 We went to McMurrays Sesame inn We had a great lunch and apps were great too! I asked for kung pow shrimp a little more spicy came same not extra spicy but I was hungry ate every bit. My friend had Triple delight she ate it all too usually she gets doggie bag. On our way out I asked why no delivery to my apt? I called weeks for lunch delivery and was told they deli ever across the street? -felt like I was in a seinfeld episode and I was Elaine! So I was told next time call ask for Joe? I will unless I order and go across street to a medical building and get it?

u02E5bvp9pq8rEMyTmff-w.text: Do not come here with kids. No changing tables in the bathroom. Food is decent but over priced. They put a pot of hot tea down on the table right in front of my 9 mos old after we had very obviously cleared that end of the table away. Our server did not even ask if we wanted drinks. No chop sticks or soy sauce unless you ask for it. Interior is dark and dated. Watched the owner play video games on his tablet while two servers were responsible for the whole restaurant. Don't waste your time unless you just want to sit at the bar and drink.

EjjfQ0AUCddU2f4Ie3JmrQ.text: Dissapointed. Dry rice, no flavor, greasy. Wonton Soup and a mediocre fortune earns this one (1) golden star. Used to be better.

xoTWVMT6inX0qIJ3AtZ19A.text: I had the general Tso's with a egg roll and it was Delicious!  The sauce was spectacular.

Vza_DygwU3lnY7WKqgLwew.text: Most consistent restaurant i've ever been too been coming here 7yrs still just as good as the first time!

lmKcDRR_4ZnWCpwIq5bLbQ.text: Sesame Inn is the place the wife and I like to sneak off to, for a pleasant lunch date, when I'm in the mood for General Tso's Chicken. I have yet to find another, as good as their's. The restaurant is always clean, the decor, beautiful, and the staff, always pleasant. We tried the location out towards Peters Township, some years back, but left disappointed. It wasn't the same IMO. That's okay, cause the Mt. Lebanon location is much closer, anyway.

TP5zhSbVWvafGd9cYEzGTg.text: BF and I went here at 9pm on a Friday night, when they closed at 10, and I have to say everyone was very nice, considering they probably wanted to wrap up and leave.   Plus, my chicken egg roll was amazing. BF's general tso shrimp was very good.   Minus, we each got a very little bowl of rice, and when we packed up our leftovers we had to ask for more rice and received very, very, little containers.   Another minus/plus, the flavor of my Capital Chicken was very good, a lot of chicken, good sauce, however, for $14, I had too many questionable pieces of chicken. I expect that from a cheap hole in the wall Chinese place where you pay $7, but for $14 and being the Sesame Inn, I definitely expected more!

11Q2a4tuU3-BK7r0EFe6Ng.text: Good stuff. The menu has a diverse selection of traditional dishes as well as some Thai dishes. Prices are reasonable and the food is tasty. Love this place

xF4snY5GHVkSfGmMngDkJA.text: My family has been among the many regulars here for the better part of 15 years. Back when I knew absolutely nothing about cuisine I loved Sesame and returning now as a hypercritical jerk I still like it. Yes, it's not healthy, and yes you may hate yourself after a huge portion of fried chicken or oily noodles, but as a guilty pleasure there are very few rivals in the South Hills.   The decor is frozen in time. The tea isn't fancy. The cuisine is inauthentic. But who really cares? Everyone is nice here and the fare tastes exactly as good as it is bad for any aspirations of health-consciousness. If you're really throwing caution to the wind then go for the fried egg roll and the wanton soup, both great, and be prepared to bring the majority of your entree back with you for another full meal or two. My one caveat would be that I don't like the non-Chinese features on the menu, i.e., go elsewhere for your Thai fix.   A final shout-out to whoever designed the cocktail list years and years ago. The little logos for each drink and the accompanying descriptions are hilarious. (Flaming Volcano - "An eruption of the finest rums fired with sacred nectars served aflame...") I hope that person went on to an illustrious career in marketing (or perhaps poetry) because these are amazing.

p1C3xCta7988h9IFd3iIZA.text: For the new Chinese Restaurant on the mount it is pretty decent.  Expanded menu with alot more choices than the old Golden Palace that was there.  Went inside to pick up a menu and there is a fresh new decor.  Placed a sizable delivery order and it was delivered in a reasonable time and everything was fresh and hot.  Very nice portions although some of their sauces are extremely salty.  Glad to have Chinese back in the mount, will order again.

mXSaxfXO8OTxWo6CzWDmSg.text: Well it's our 2nd take out here at wasn't as good as 1st. I wasn't in a mood of eating a whole meal, so just decided to give a try to their sample platter of appetizers. My man ordered Thai cuisine which was fine, it's just the rice was kind old, seemed stayed in a rice cooker for a while... Any appetizers include coconut shrimp, egg rolls, crab Rangoon, bbq ribs and chicken teriyaki sticks. From all I got I ate chicken and ribs cause everything else was over fried, old & not fresh... And the main thing about this place it's not as cheap as all Chinese restaurants around mount Lebanon. I'll think about next time ordering food from there.

7ny5onjeCD_4iby0hUIDMQ.text: I really like it.   The food is tasty and the service is consistent.  And it's reliable - I've dined here or gotten take out many times and it is always the same, always very good.   I can recommend the Amazing Chicken and the General Tso's. While neither breaks any new ground, the chicken is good and crispy and the sauce just a bit spicy.   Egg rolls are crispy and good, too!

O9ivqb77Jw6zDV-VGFMLAA.text: My favorite Chinese in the Pittsburgh area.  Everything is top quality from the atmosphere to the food.  My favorite dish is the amazing chicken.  It is similar to general tsos but with a little twist.  I have also had the general tsos, sesame chicken, and the chicken fried rice and always been impressed.    It is a little pricy, however the quality of food you get makes it worth it.

fKCM1Q2SO2sUkILTE9RvXQ.text: One of my favorite go to Chinese places in a pinch. Great for takeout especially. Food is typical of Chinese restaurants in the area. They have a few different locations. This location is a little annoying because if parking. It is also located on an upper level which could be a problem for some of you can't ascend stairs. Prices are pretty average. I've only ever had the chicken and broccoli, general tso's, sweet and sour chicken and orange chicken. All dishes were good and would get again. The food is always pretty consistent and has never been bad. Large portions too!

CmO45gq2OYpwbWeRfxm2HA.text: The food  it self is good.However the amount is't good for what you paid for.My mother only got two shrimps.I got only one Potato.The waitress was friendly and good.

EQWQ4mH6ZTwl6FRCtHI2MQ.text: I have been coming here for years and I tell you I like the ambiance of the restaurant itself. Though this is a local chain, this is by far the best one. Amazing Chicken is well...amazing!

Lu-YAGctEDWisk4TYsZawQ.text: This place is trash! Horrible service. I ordered the orange chicken and I received the sweet and sour. I called back to let them know they gave me the wrong order. I was put on the line with a manager and they pulled up the receipt. They said "you ordered the sweet and sour chicken. The person that took your order has that in." But they simply ignored the mistake and and didn't offer to do anything. There was a long pause and I hung up. They didn't apologize or offer to retake my order. I will not be returning.

rT0Hp6GGknsNO5XttipzMw.text: Came here on business from Los Angeles and it was the perfect dinner. Couldn't ask for more. Stop by you'll enjoy it.

MB9AaCDJz82A3uKXTvNPBg.text: Very great service and my favorite sushi spot in pgh! Sushi is my favorite food so I have tried tons of places and this is my go-to! The rolls I recommend trying are the mango roll, heaven roll, spicy tuna, and rainbow roll. You will not be disappointed. I love heir cocktails also- I had a cucumber vodka lime drink which was so refreshing.

nPbGKmHThnH8GrILm4IM0w.text: Their General Tso's Chicken is better than most Chinese restaurants in the area. When I visit various Chinese restaurants, I tend to always order the General Tso's to try to find which restaurant has the best in Pittsburgh. For $9, their lunch special is a pretty good deal, and you get a good portion of chicken, rice, and an egg roll. Overall, I would say the Sesame Inn is above average, and a good spot to pick up lunch if you are in the mood for some Chinese food.

zeH8dcPIzaF8XQPVUCiL3g.text: My favorite Chinese food place in the city!! Great sashimi too!! I always get the pork fried dumplings, sashimi, and Chinese ribs to share with my bf. Soo good!

Vb_dHB11C-1xaNo5bUqudA.text: Good chinese place at an affordable price   have lot to choose  Try their singapore street noodle

YfJqg0Ama9U5C8b1jcrZ1g.text: Good food, and our go-to Chinese restaurant. Very nice decor, with a good mix of traditional Chinese and Thai, plus sushi. But it can be infuriating when you want to order takeout because phone calls often roll to Verizon where you hear that they're not available. A regular busy signal would be better than wondering if the place is still in business.

BkFjlWYJhJZ_3RgeAeElDA.text: I have a unexpected love affair with seasme inn that started one night on account of take out and has been growing ever since. Seriously if you're looking for delicious American- Chinese food without all of the grease and questionable meat items- you'd be crazy not to try and fall in love with this place.   I've never actually eaten in at the Mt Lebo location, I always just get take out because it is so close to my house. Typically, I order the General tsos chicken for me and the string beans with chicken for my fiance- both come with steamed white rice.   The portions are extremely generous, literally enough for two meals worth. The pieces of chicken are always huge and REAL- again not strange is this or is this not chicken that you might get from other Chinese take out places. The quality of the food is top notch and honestly though the prices are more steep than other Chinese restaurants it's 100% worth it for the quantity and quality you get.   Also, each time I've gotten take out their staff have always been really friendly. Actually, when I give my number they have my past orders on file so if I'm re- ordering my go-to's (noted above) then it's a quick and easy phone call.   Overall, love this place and I will continue to go here until my love affair burns out (which I don't see happening).

yRu89aPF4LSmLjNr_6jE6w.text: Sesame Inn's stylized, fiery red signage and pagoda-shaped awning averted our gazes as we drove up Washington Road in search of unYelped eats. Entering its doors, we walked up a flight of stairs towards a commodious, white banquet hall of a dining room with sculptures and Oriental musical instruments furbishing the interiors.   Sesame Inn is a local chain of somewhat upscale Asian restaurants with an emphasis on Chinese favorites, all of which I've seemingly had before in varying permutations. Deciding to eschew the familiar during a recent visit to this posh, penthouse-like location in luxurious Mt. Lebanon, I treated Kay and myself to some sushi and a sampling of Thailand.   Kamikaze Rolls opened the proceedings with a tempura-battered flair and bombast. An artistically stacked and embellished sextet of bronze medallions filled with smoked salmon, cream cheese, tamago, avocado, and asparagus dazzled our taste sensors with a blend of richness, creaminess, tartness and a crunchy yet elegant mouthfeel. Earth-toned ribbons of various smooth, mayonnaise-based (?) sauces or condiments further enhanced the deep-fried fantasy like suds unleashed during a rave.  This is why sushi still captivates in spite of its now mainstream status.   Desiring an entree I'd yet to try, I opted for a bazaar of a dish in Mussaman. My chosen protein of shrimp may have been what the course was centered around, but it was the exquisitely sour tamarind that truly made it shimmer albeit subtly. Onions, pineapple, string beans, and potatoes would make the Mussman nourishing while tamarind brought the sass, peanuts provided texture, and coconut milk tamed whatever magical fires the curry mischievously ignited.   With above par service, ornate environs, exemplary food, and moderate pricing, one is reminded that PF Chang's is blasphemy and that Asian cuisine is better on lavish plates in restaurants than it is in cardboard cartons at home.  P.S. Sesame Inn does a nifty Sunday brunch that costs between $11 and $13 a head and includes  soup, salad (or egg roll), a beverage (champagne costs just $1 extra), and an entree.

photos.caption: Photo of Sesame Inn Chinese Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mussaman with shrimp
Photo of Sesame Inn Chinese Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Kamikaze Rolls (tempura style)
Photo of Sesame Inn Chinese Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. interiors

Sn6FiyTFKCrCIRG7RiSKqA.text: This is my favorite dine-in American-Chinese restaurant in Pittsburgh. The food here is always on point and the service is always attentive. You have to go upstairs to get to the restaurant but the little climb is so worth it. The decor here is very inviting, not bare and minimalist like many other Chinese restaurants and the restaurant is very clean. Everything I've had here has been delicious and fresh. Surprisingly, the pad Thai is good here too. I, however, have never ordered sushi here as it wasn't always part of their menu. Delicious, high quality American-Chinese restaurant.

RDjcfo44fcuUf_LcjLKOnA.text: Downloaded this app and made an account just to give a one star review. They would not pick up their phone and it went to a strange service line saying all lines were busy. The damn place is infuriating don't bother

eiQ0yzMFjIoyQVGJCDH5aA.text: Excellent place and within walking distance from home makes it's a favorite place! I have nothing bad whatsoever to write about. The food, service and quality is perfect.

c0EJiLhJjNg7pizsB25_fA.text: Favorite Chinese Restaurant!!  Always the best food with lots of choices.  Pricey but worth it.

QGu29ZD4DiFHQuM6MKRG5w.text: Less than average American Chinese menu. Wait staff was rude when I asked for some substitutions because of my diet...not cool. My dining partner order sushi and they said it was ok. My family style tofu dish was bland as I've ever had it. Egg Roll was greasy. The side of white rice was hot and free so there's that. Go to Jade Grille. It's one billion times better.

q1yikhxj8d4mLRlCiDdxxA.text: Foods are delicious, high quality. Very clean restaurant  and good environment,  We all enjoy it,

jTmd89WZvEG0GbXz59lIRQ.text: Excellent Chinese cuisine  This is our takeout order  Never disappoints  Fast friendly delivery we order there three times a month  Great selection never gets old always have leftovers for next day the portions are so generous

photos.caption: Photo of Sesame Inn Chinese Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Singapore noodles
Photo of Sesame Inn Chinese Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sesame noodles

PPh5Y8U_RnOhMb9ZOXqxnw.text: This place was terrible  The shrimp was chewy, scallops were cold, and the fish in the dish was fried. It was one of the worst restaurant experiences I have ever had !!

QIG0mPJvv6K0XvvWpPaj2Q.text: Maybe I ordered the wrong food?  After waiting about ten minutes for our waitress to come to the table, I asked the hostess if we could get service and she assured me that the waitress would be on her way over. She seemed to be the only server working.   The crazy tuna roll was lacking flavor, and the soy sauce tasted like there was ten lbs of salt in it.   The shrimp with "lobster sauce" and brown rice was disappointing to say the least. It was $18 and had no flavor what so ever, I asked hot sauce to it just so I could eat it and feel somewhat fulfilled.   Would not recommend this restaurant, mainly because there are other comparable restaurants that are much better within walking distance. This is sad because I believe the sesame in a little further down Rt. 19 is much, much better.

photos.caption: Photo of Sesame Inn Chinese Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crazy tuna... not very impressive
Photo of Sesame Inn Chinese Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster sauce was so watery and had zero flavor. Absolutely not worth the price. (This is 1/2 eaten photo...obviously)

kFHu8Xme02m5L93E_PnrTA.text: I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of meal I had here! I've passed this restaurant many times without stopping in, so I was excited to finally try it. We began with vegetable egg rolls - they were delicious and a nice size. The spicy mustard got rave reviews from my fellow diners.  For our main course, our party of 3 split: eggplant chicken, orange beef, and chicken pad Thai. All of the portion sizes were large and even after stuffing ourselves we had leftovers. The orange beef was my favorite of the three - very flavorful though a little sweet. The eggplant in the chicken dish was cooked perfectly. I do, however, wish there had been more tofu dishes. While it's not the best Chinese food I've ever had, it's up there! If I'm ever in the area again with a craving for orange beef, I'll definitely stop by.

photos.caption: Photo of Sesame Inn Chinese Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken with eggplant
Photo of Sesame Inn Chinese Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Orange beef
Photo of Sesame Inn Chinese Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pad Thai

C0naNxtTD4WnQepet8w4Dw.text: The Sesame Inn is perfectly located in downtown Mt Lebo and is about a two minute walk from a parking garage. To reach the Sesame Inn, you go up a flight of stairs and there is a large seating area and bar. The Sesame Inn is a typical Chinese food joint which offers your "traditional" Chinese dinners and sides and also has a variety of sushi's and Thai food. There are weekend specials and and lunch specials and the menu is large enough that anyone can find something. I'd recommend the amazing chicken as a top dish. The chicken truly is amazing - perfectly battered and served with the appropriate amount of sauce and flavor. All dinner portions are very generous and the quality is as good as expected. With a street full of Mediterranean, Mexican and Asian restaurants, the Sesame Inn more than holds its own.

photos.caption: Photo of Sesame Inn Chinese Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Restaurant area
Photo of Sesame Inn Chinese Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken , Pork , Roast Pork , Or Beef Broccoli Amazing chicken

2uXUmCZ8iZkwp17wwnJmKw.text: Delicious!  We ventured here for dinner on Friday night for the first time since we moved here 3 years ago. Man we wish we had come sooner! Definitely will be our top choice for a casual sit down meal in the future!  Our waitress was super friendly and on top of everything. She explained items to us that we needed clarification on & made suggestions for items when we couldn't decide!  We got the Golden Gate roll as our appetizer because I'm not a fan of the raw sushi (I know that's annoying). But it was delicious! Six large pieces of slightly spicy sushi with sliced shrimp on top that was very fresh & looked great! I'd recommend this for sure!   We then ordered the lo mein noodles with roasted pork, as well as the General Tsos chicken with white rice to each share.  Our waitress recommended the roasted pork over the standard pork as she described it to be a BBQ type of taste & deeper roasted flavor which was spot on. The lo mein noodles had a nice soy/teriyaki flavor with lots of pork, sliced mushrooms, green onions, bamboo shoots, and carrots. Delicious & a nice portion for the price.  The general Tsos chicken was very good - a bit stickier than I'm used to, and not spicy AT ALL. If I were to order this again, I'd ask for some heat because it was very sweet.  The white rice was fresh & yummy.  This was definitely a solid, high quality Chinese meal with a great atmosphere & top notch customer service. Check this place out the next time you are craving some sushi or Chinese cuisine!

qLKCEGAfV2QsqZ7JkEpBKg.text: I love Sesame Inn. It's consistently satisfying and the portions are very generous. My husband grew up in Mt. Lebanon and has been a regular at Sesame Inn his entire life. We've moved to the suburbs and regularly make the trek back for dinner. Our favorite dishes are the Lo Mein, Cashew Chicken, and the Amazing Chicken. The wonton soup is also delicious and they have great egg rolls.   Sesame Inn is truly a gem and I hope it's around for years to come.

4VA7IpArI6nUwzENc9HusA.text: Good quality all around - taste, texture and service 5/5 stars. The price is higher than most Chinese places however and the portions were a little small for me (I have a big appetite) - I guess that is why they call it fine dining but I still think it isn't the greatest deal for the price.   Only other thing is that their wasn't enough vegetable based dishes - the vegetables that I did eat were completely delicious but there just wasn't enough of them! I also feel like they give you way too much meat (even though the meat is delicious) but maybe that is just me.  I would not hesitate to go back here nonetheless and would recommend this place highly to others who might not mind paying a little more for higher quality food or who don't require a vegetable based diet. If this place could make more vegetable based dishes and either give me a bigger portion or lower their price I will not hesitate to increase my review to a perfect 5 out of 5 stars :)

Euh8MXDMSlW3XiVTBxEe-g.text: Hands down the BEST Chinese restaurant in Pittsburgh! And   If I could live on Chinese food for the rest of my life, I would. It is my favorite type of food. So I have gone to many places and had average Chinese food. Nothing disappointing but nothing to rave about....that was until I've met Sesame Inn.   I've been here many times and have even ordered takeout. Don't think I've ever had a meal here that I've been disappointed in. The flavors are amazing.   I highly recommend starting your meal off with the egg rolls. They're done to perfection. The right amount of crisp!   When I order my dinner here, I usually rotate between the following: Chicken Lo Mein, Chicken with Broccoli, or Amazing Chicken. Mmmm....writing this review is making me crave it!!!   Love this place because the food is always so quick! Even when the place is very busy, it will still come out in a respectable amount of time. The service is always wonderful.   10/10 recommend this place.

ltraMkp5m1eyxyPAHjCYnA.text: Have ordered take out from here the Mt Lebanon location several times and the flavor has been just meh. Today we ordered Sichuan chicken extra spicy, fried dumplings and an egg roll. The food chicken was very bland. The dumplings were gummy also no flavor and the egg roll tasted like a frozen food variety (the cabbage tasted old). The quality of the food in Mcmurray is a lot better.

GUmjRvA4epgePBJjlIqPZw.text: we ordered the ahi tuna appetizer and i got the volcano chicken and my mom got the bride and groom. both entrees were BIG! i got three meals of the whole thing. it was okay, as was my moms. the beef was cooked well. there was a lot of sauce, which was a bit overwhelming.  but this ahi tuna app - one of, if not, THE best ahi tuna i have ever had. it was fresh, seasoned perfectly, and the toppings were literally amazing. i would have eaten 10 of them.

3lSaOyyLtNy2ZyqIN6AnbA.text: No return visit for me.  I ordered Beef and Broccoli. It was horrible.  We waited forever for our meal.  The food was barely warm.  It was the worst tasting dish I ever had. Brian's General Tsao had a weird taste to it,   The place for dinner time was not busy only one other couple . They were all hanging out by the counter giggling. Neither one of us ate our food.  Money wasted won't go back

lOZVV4jvQlwPKgcU-a0uXg.text: You can never go wrong with Sesame Inn. We love their Happy Family, Cashew Chicken, pork dumplings, veggie egg rolls and lo mein noddles for sharing or hoarding.

2opFY3Kk45SBeC_RPkCZ_A.text: Went in a group of four. Service was quick and good. The staff were nice to us. The rating I gave is the average over multiple items that we ordered and also includes a 4/5 rating for the service.   Starting with the beauty Alaska rolls which are fresh and the salmon had a smoked flavor. I would give this 4/5 because I found the sauce to be overwhelming, but with appropriate quantities, the rolls were tasty. They offer 8 rolls. The price was reasonable for the quality and quantity.   The chicken fried rice was tasty but the chicken looked dry and unappetizing. The fried rice minus chicken is a good dish with appropriate amounts of spice and seasoning along with veggies. I will give this a 4/5.   The salt and pepper shrimp to me looked like a fried shrimp with some salt and pepper sprinkled over it. They served the shrimp over a bed of lettuce and garlic accompanied by few broccoli. The combination didn't appeal to me. In addition, the shrimp tasted like fried dough that lacked seasoning. Though the shrimp seemed to be good quality, the dish as a whole didn't impress me. I would give this a 2/5.   The sesame chicken consisted of chunks of well cooked and seasoned chicken covered with sweet sesame sauce and topped with sesame seeds served over fried noodles. Based on the instructions on the menu, we thought this would be a spicy dish, but it ended up being a sweet dish. The person who took our order didn't tell us about the difference. However, I still liked the dish. The texture was sticky and mushy and the chicken pieces were too big. My rating for this dish is 3/5.   I don't think I will go back again since I prefer Sichuan flavors. However, if you like American version of Chinese food, I recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Sesame Inn Chinese Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sesame chicken
Photo of Sesame Inn Chinese Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken fried rice
Photo of Sesame Inn Chinese Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beauty Alaska roll

4ELLo4uFt2sEwyNZ4cXfcw.text: Went here for a Mother's Day - never again!  I had called to make my reservation for their earliest time slot, 12 noon.  When we arrived Sunday expecting brunch, as their website mentioned, the waiter told us there was no brunch, even though our Sesame Inn menu included a brunch menu.  Then when we asked about the lunch offerings, also in the restaurant menu, we were told there was no lunch option - only dinner entrees.  This was noon.  And it wasn't what their website said.  Nor was it ever conveyed to me during our 3 phone calls (2 from the restaurant reminding me of my reservation).   Our food took forever to arrive and was barely warm.  It was so sweet my sister in law could barely eat hers.  In addition, our waiter screwed up my brother's order - substituting chicken for his Shrimp entree.    If misleading customers from your website and menu is okay; and then not delivering what customers order is okay, then by all means this is a fine place.

LEG1mbcIvo6F6A7nKCgPcA.text: Went to Sesame Inn in Mt. Lebanon this evening. Purchased a bottle of wine with full course meal. Manager would not allow me to take the remaining wine home with me. Explained that PA Liqour Control Board passed law, Act 59 that states that any restaurant with liquor license may allow patron to take home remaining portion of bottled wine if recorked. Manager would not allow me to leave with the wine. $35 down the drain unless they plan on "reselling" the wine. Will be contacting the sate. This seems very unseemly.

FjPTVbCzRK07vnaIVaB7qw.text: Food is delicious here. Two of my favs are the crab Rangoon's and cashew chicken. Full menu with appetizers, sushi and dinner. They also have lunch specials and Sunday brunch. The atmosphere is very cozy and calm.   The sushi bar sits in a cozy part of the restaurant. The staff are wonderful and attentive. Very friendly. The only con is that I didn't notice an elevator and there are quite a few steps to walk up. The restarting sits on a second floor. Take out is available.

photos.caption: Photo of Sesame Inn Chinese Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Delicious sushi made fresh
Photo of Sesame Inn Chinese Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Full bar and great wine selection
Photo of Sesame Inn Chinese Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

TlH51pzFDEUStP9nu4OMsg.text: Always great food and never fails it's been that way for many many years been going there never had a bad meal once

IMt3HyfTTZxfgeqzvoHYJg.text: As much as I like to avoid a franchise restaurant, this is one of our go-to place for american-Chinese cuisine. I guess I'll take solace in the fact that I am still supporting a local franchise :)   The place itself is pretty spacious and ideal for groups. They have two different seating areas including a full bar at the main area. The place is clean and the servers and service so far has been pretty good.  The food especially their in house specialties and traditional dishes are really good. No disrespect to the chef but if you're in the mood for the Pad thai or Sushi - I suggest you go to a thai or a Japanese restaurant.  So far during my visit here, I've had the Mongolian Beef/Pork, Amazing Chicken, General Tso ofcourse, Sesame Chicken, Mapo Tofu, Singaporean Noodles (don't recommend), Fried Rice, Lomein to name a few. I highly recommend the Mongolian Beef or Pork. Also, the portions served during the dinner hours are huge and reasonably priced - so order accordingly.

photos.caption: Photo of Sesame Inn Chinese Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bar
Photo of Sesame Inn Chinese Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Sesame Inn Chinese Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Greens. Not on the menu but can be ordered.

0skIg6fJGmFe8TtVaNnubA.text: Nice little space where you aren't sure at first you're in the right space, up the stairs and through the door and boom awesome restaurant.   We got a lot of food. Vegetable eggs roll, which was ok but I'd like to try a different variety next time, it was a bit boring. I tried the egg drop soup which was great for my cold but not exactly a traditional egg drop soup. It had peas and carrots added which I've never seen before but it tasted delicious.  We also got the sesame noodles which was a cold salad appetizer. My fiance LOVED it. I thought it was good too very peanuty and yummy. Finally he got the Mongolian beef and I got the sesame shrimp. The shrimp was soooo good, a little spicy but not crazy by any means. I would definitely get it again. And the beef was delicious  too!   They were super nice and everything came out fast. It was a good visit. We'll be back.
